Legal_Issue: Whether the citizenship judge correctly applied the residency requirement under the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed 1055 days of presence, 40 days short of the required 1095 days; submitted incomplete passport records and provided conflicting evidence
Court_Ruling: The judge's decision was reasonable; applicant did not meet the physical presence test
Grounds_for_Claim: Insufficient proof of residency days due to missing passport and conflicting evidence
Assessment_Factor: Use of 'physical presence' or 'normally resident' tests; consistency in application
Procedural_Issue: Federal Court review of administrative decision
Credibility_Assessment: Judge questioned the reliability of the applicant's evidence
Evidence_Used: Passport records, applicant testimony, residency logs
Legal_Provision_Cited: Requirement of 1095 days of residence within four years under the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Assessed: Inconclusive evidence regarding exact number of residency days
Relief_Sought: Judicial review of citizenship judge’s decision
Governing_Rule: Applicants must accumulate 1095 days of residence in Canada over four years; judge may apply either 'physical presence' or 'normally resident' test consistently
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Missing passport documentation, lack of corroborating evidence
Outcome: Appeal dismissed; residency requirement not met
Decisional_Body: Citizenship judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Cause_Description: Applicant's insufficient proof of residency days due to missing passport and conflicting evidence
Evidence_Handling: Judge assessed evidence as inconclusive; ambiguity in 'ongoing presence' language did not affect fairness
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section of the Citizenship Act requiring 1095 days of physical presence
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete travel records, unverified claims of continuous residence
Legal_Provision: Citizenship Act – Residency Requirement (1095 days in four years)
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence found insufficient to prove required residency duration
Decision_Rationale: Judge reasonably concluded applicant failed to meet burden of proof under physical presence test
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of objective documentation to verify claimed residency days
